children.value: A higher level helper class that inherits the
. Primarily intended for automating browser tests from Node.js shell scripts.

starts a Chromium browser instance and a server and opens a page with a URL that loads a script from the server. The script that runs in the browser is expected to report test results back using predefined global functions.
must be installed as dev dependencies.
// This is the script that runs in Node.js and starts the browser
In your script that is run on the browser:
// App is done running, terminate the browser instance
Starts a dev server, e.g. a webpack-dev-server that bundles a test script.
Opens a browser page to run the test script.
Extracts test reports from the browser back into node
Closes browser, server and terminates the current node script.
Passes an exit status (e.g. pass/fail) back to the invoking shell.
(Boolean) - whether to run the test in headless mode. If
, all console outputs from the test app will be piped to the shell. If
, the browser window will remain open for debugging.
If an object is supplied: used as options to create a dev server. Passed to
If a function is supplied: will be called to create a dev server. Should return a
that resolves to the service URL.
(Object) - options to user for creating the Puppeteer instance. Passed to
(Object) - keys are function names to be added to the page's
object, and the values are callback functions to execute in Node.js. See
(String) - if supplied, will be used instead of the URL returned by the dev server.

instance exposes a series of global functions to the browser application.
The following functions can be called from the browser application to communicate with the nodejs script:
Notify the node script that some test has failed.
Notify the node script that the app has finished executing and the browser should be closed.
Truthy if the current test environment is headless.
Request a pixel diff between the current page and a reference "golden image." This can be used to verify that the page is visually rendered as expected.
(String) - path to the golden image, relative to the directory where the shell command is executed
(Object, optional) - a bounding box to take a screenshot of. In shape of
relative to the page. If not specified, will take a screenshot of the whole page.
(Number, optional) - the matching score for the test to pass. Between
(Number, optional) - the tolerance when comparing two pixels. Between
, all pixels are compared. Otherwise detect and ignore anti-aliased pixels. Default
, will generate binary image data that highlight the mismatched pixels. Default
, any screenshots that failed to meet the target matching rate will be saved to disk for further investigation. Default
(String, optional) - the filename to save the screenshot as. If the string contains
, it will be replaced by the golden image path. Default
that resolves to an object with the following fields:
(Boolean) - whether the test passed. A test can fail either because the matching score is lower than the specified
(Boolean) - whether the browser was running in headless mode.
(Uint8Array) - image data that highlight the mismatched pixels. Only if
// ctrl + S is pressed! do something
Dispatch an emulated user input to the page. The following event types are supported:
Press a key on the keyboard.
(Number) - the time between keydown and keyup. Default
(Boolean) - whether to press the key with the shift key down. Default
(Boolean) - whether to press the key with the control key down. Default
(Boolean) - whether to press the key with the meta key down. Default
Click the mouse at a given screen coordinate.
(Number) - the screen x of the click.
(Number) - the screen y of the click.
(Number) - the time between mousedown and mouseup. Default
(Boolean) - whether to click with the shift key down. Default
(Boolean) - whether to click with the control key down. Default
(Boolean) - whether to click with the meta key down. Default
Move the mouse to a given screen coordinate.
(Number) - the screen x to move the pointer to.
(Number) - the screen y to move the pointer to.
(Number) - how many intermediate mousemove events to generate, default
Drag the mouse from a given screen coordinate to another.
(Number) - the screen x to drag from.
(Number) - the screen y to drag from.
(Number) - the screen x to drag to.
(Number) - the screen y to drag to.
(Number) - how many intermediate mousemove events to generate, default
(Boolean) - whether to drag with the shift key down. Default
(Boolean) - whether to drag with the control key down. Default
(Boolean) - whether to drag with the meta key down. Default
